intro: Zollernia kanukuensis, commonly known as the Kanuku zollernia, is a rare flowering plant native to the dense rainforests of Central Africa. It is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from deep violet to pale blue, attracting specific pollinators such as certain species of bees and butterflies. The plant has a woody stem with smooth, dark green leaves that are opposite in arrangement. Its unique floral structure and habitat requirements make it a subject of interest for botanists studying plant-pollinator interactions. Due to habitat loss, Zollernia kanukuensis is classified as endangered, highlighting the need for conservation efforts in its native region.
